comment: He is tough! Be prepared to work outside of class to understand the material. The book is very important. He is a kind older guy with a tremendous amount of knowledge about the subjects he teaches, but sometimes has a hard time teaching. I would not take him again strictly for that reason. If you ever need info about something he has it. CURVE!

This is a very difficult class.  My advice is to focus a lot of time on the fundamental problems in the textbook.  The test and Quiz problems will be more difficult than these but it will help to understand the concept.  Remain calm and think logically.  Test and quiz problems are usually from the book.  He curves at the end.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Nice enough guy, but he's not a good teacher. I've had him for 3 different classes and they've all been the same. Come to class, pay attention, do homework, then you still don't understand it. He's just not very good at teaching the subjects although he knows them like the back of his hand (for the most part). Avoid him if you can..... I couldn't.

comment: Grading is tough because he doesn't explicitly tell you, anything, and what he says contradicts often. So if you're allowed a formula sheet, quadruple check it only has allowed formulae. He is always retracting and busting your ass for points. He is an excellent example of knows his crap but can the teach crap if it meant his entrance to heaven.

comment: He knows the material very well, but his explanations and lectures do not always reflect it. Homework is necessary to do well in class and lecture. Lab reports are long. Very few grades in class (2-5), so tests and final are the most important. If you demonstrate you are trying and putting in real effort, he will notice. Will curve if class bombs.

*Strokes beard* talks about his past jobs.* Flips a few pages* starts an example and doesn't finish it. This man needs to retire. You won't learn anything in his class, he makes his own test so the book isn't much help, take anybody else if you can.

Covers material in an unbelievable fast pace. Gives ridiculous amounts of homework for every class. Tests and quizes are hard and then some. Not good at teaching, you have to do that on your own in his class.

horrible at teaching the subject matter, starts examples but doesnt finish them. gives a TON of homework. No cheat sheet or FE handbook allowed on quizzes or tests. Class average was in the toilet when i dropped the class.

He said he hadn't taught Engineering Materials for about 8 years. Everyone in the class was lost come test time. Majority failed or barely passed tests. He did curve at the end, but only because student called him out in class and met with the dean. I worked my butt off, as did everyone else and think (after the curve) the best grade was a B.

I had him for orientation class.  He was pretty laid back for that class, the best part was the team design challenge at the end of the semester.  It's always something new, but it is tough to come up with a workable solution.  I'd recommend him for this class, I've heard that he is a lot tougher in higher level courses though.

The man is a Nazi when it comes to making test hard. But he grades fair if you know what your doing on the problems.  Lots of partial credit.  Did all he could to help me pass the class, but still hard as hell.  Be sure to do all your homework and then some if you want a good grade.
Good guy....not easy...but will do his best to teach anyone
